div.head: Statistics
div.p: These are some statistics on variant types, generated through a Python script that processes the XML code:

list.item: 'App' elements with @type="punctuation" cannot be considered actual MS variants (see paragraph 'Punctuation variants' above). Also 'app' elements with @type="gap-in-ms" and @type="illegible-in-ms" do not correspond to actual variants: they mark gaps or illegible text in the MS.

This leaves us with a total of
actual variants (V), only counting types "substantive", "transposition" (counted once, henceforth) and "orthographic".

Of all variants (V):
% are substantive (SV) % are transpositions (TV) % are orthographic (OV)

Of all substantive variants (SV):
(% of SV) have @subtype 'num-num' (two different numerals)
(% of SV) have @subtype 'missing-in-ms' (integrations)
(% of SV) have @subtype 'missing-in-print' (expunctions)
( of SV) have @subtype 'fs' (confusion between 'f' and 's')
